Package io.github.ethankelly

Class Graph

java.lang.Object
io.github.ethankelly.Graph
public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
A graph is a collection of vertices connected by edges in some configuration. While the basis for the model is agency, this agency is represented as interactions of vertices of a graph.

Using a graph to represent and examine allows the use of many excellent existing results in graph theory, plus the use of a graph is not an unusual choice of visualisation in models of contagion even intuitively. The graphs to be used in this model, objects of this class, have two important attributes:

  • The number of vertices in the graph.
  • An adjacency matrix - each entry is true if the vertices represented by the row and column are connected by an edge, false otherwise (@see https://mathworld.wolfram.com/AdjacencyMatrix.html).
In much of the literature, graphs of this kind represent 'contact networks.'

    • minDistance

      public int minDistance​(int[] pathArray, java.lang.Boolean[] shortestPathSet)
      Helper method for calculating the shortest path, returns the minimum value of an array of path lengths if such a minimum value exists.
      Parameters:
      pathArray - a collection of minimum distances from some vertex, v.
      shortestPathSet - array containing whether a shortest path exists from v to each vertex.
      Returns:
      the index of the minimum value path distance from the path array.

    • shortestPath

      public int[] shortestPath​(int vertex)
      Given the current state of the model, calculates the shortest paths from a given vertex to every other vertex
      Parameters:
      vertex - the vertex relative to which we want to calculate paths.
      Returns:
      the shortest path to each other vertex in the graph (if one exists).

    • getAdjMatrix

      public boolean[][] getAdjMatrix()
      An adjacency matrix represents a (finite) graph by indicating whether a pair of vertices share an edge between them. At the intersection of row i, column j, if the value is 1 there is an edge from i to j and if it's zero then there is no such edge. In our uses, graphs will mostly be bidirectional, meaning this value will be the same in row i, column j and row j, column i.
      Returns:
      the adjacency matrix of the graph

    • setAdjMatrix

      public void setAdjMatrix​(boolean[][] adjMatrix)
      Some methods update the adjacency matrix when called - this method makes this update.
      Parameters:
      adjMatrix - the updated version of the adjacency matrix to set.

    • isEdge

      public boolean isEdge​(int i, int j)
      Determines whether there exists an edge between two vertices in a graph.
      Parameters:
      i - first vertex
      j - second vertex
      Returns:
      true if i and j share an edge, false otherwise

      public int randomVertex​(int numVertices)
      Selects a random vertex from the set of vertices to begin the setOutbreak.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
